intro: Lobelia puberula, commonly known as the woolly lobelia, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture. Lobelia puberula thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and wetlands.
